title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Put a large saucepan of water on to boil.
Fry the pancetta until crisp and golden.
Beat the eggs in a medium bowl, season with a little freshly grated black pepper and set everything aside.
Add spaghetti to the boiling water with a pinch of salt and cook according to the package instructions.
Save some of the pasta water, then drain the spaghetti and add it to the pancetta.
Take the pan off the heat and quickly pour in the eggs and cheese. Use tongs to mix everything together, adding a little pasta water if needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with a sprinkling of the remaining cheese and a grating of black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala

title: Dry Rice
instructions: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Add the salt and oil to the boiling water.
Add the rice and stir gently to prevent sticking.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
